sen.j: 山崎駅（やまざきえき）は、京都府乙訓郡大山崎町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）東海道本線（JR京都線）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, Yamazaki Station is a stop on the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Yamazaki Station, located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Yamazaki Station, located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅（相互利用可能ICカードはICOCAの項を参照）。
sen.e: At Yamazaki Station, ICOCA/J-THRU are available (refer to the section of ICOCA with respect to mutually available IC cards).
At Yamazaki Station, ICOCA/J-THRU are available (refer to the section on ICOCA with respect to the mutually available IC cards).
At Yamazaki Station, ICOCA/J-Through cards can be used (refer to the section on ICOCA with respect to the mutually available IC cards).
sen.cmt: can be used としました。

sen.j: 駅舎は京都府内にあるが、敷地の一部は大阪府三島郡 (大阪府)島本町山崎にあり、ホーム上に県境を示す表示がある。
sen.e: Although the station building is located in Kyoto Prefecture, part of the station site resides in Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Mishima-gun, Osaka Prefecture; there is a sign on the platform that indicates the prefectural boundary.

Although the station building is located in Kyoto Prefecture, part of the station site resides in Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Mishima-gun, Osaka Prefecture, and there is a sign on the platform that indicates the prefectural boundary.

Although the station building is located in Kyoto Prefecture, part of the station site resides in Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Mishima-gun, Osaka Prefecture, and there is a sign on the platform that indicates the prefectural boundary.

sen.j: 駅の大阪方の曲線（通称サントリーカーブ）は鉄道写真撮影のメッカとして有名である。
sen.e: A curve (unofficially called a Suntory curve) extending in the direction of Osaka from the station is famous as a key site for taking pictures of trains.
A curve (unofficially called the Suntory curve) extending in the direction of Osaka from the station is famous as a key site for taking pictures of trains.
A curve (unofficially called the Suntory curve) extending in the direction of Osaka from the station is famous as a key site for taking pictures of trains.

sen.j: 島本駅が開業するまで、隣の高槻駅までの距離はJR京都線で最長であった。
sen.e: Until Shimamoto Station was opened, the distance from Yamazaki Station to the next Takatsuki Station had been the longest compared to other sections on the JR Kyoto Line.
Until Shimamoto Station was opened, the distance from Yamazaki Station to the next station, Takatsuki, had been the longest compared to other sections on the JR Kyoto Line.
Until Shimamoto Station was opened, the distance from Yamazaki Station to the next station, Takatsuki, had been the longest compared to other sections on the JR Kyoto Line.

sen.j: プラットホーム2面4線と下り線に側線一本がある地上駅である。
sen.e: Yamazaki Station is an aboveground station with two platforms serving four tracks and a side track on the outbound track.
Yamazaki Station is an aboveground station with two platforms serving four tracks and a side track on the outbound track.
Yamazaki Station is an aboveground station with two platforms serving four tracks and a side track on the outbound track.

sen.j: 外側線側は封鎖されている。
sen.e: The outside tracks have been closed.
The outside tracks have been closed.
The outside tracks have been closed.

sen.j: 傾斜面上にホームがあるため、駅舎はホームより下層に設けられている。
sen.e: Since the platforms stand on the sloped side, the station building is located in the lower level compared to the platforms.
Because the platforms stand on the sloped side, the station building is located at a lower level compared to the platforms.
Because the platforms stand on the sloped side, the station building is located at a lower level compared to the platforms.

sen.j: 駅の先すぐに京都寄りはR5の急カーブとなるので、通過電車は駅構内手前から100km/hに減速する。
sen.e: The tracks on the Kyoto side of the station immediately form a steep curve of R5, whereby the trains passing the station reduce their speed to 100 km/h before they enter the station.
The tracks on the Kyoto side of the station immediately form a steep curve of R5, a consequently the trains passing the station reduce their speed to 100 km/h before they enter the station.
The tracks on the Kyoto side of the station immediately form a steep curve of R5, and consequently the trains passing the station reduce their speed to 100 km/h before they enter the station.

sen.j: かつてはサントリーの工場が隣接するためにより大規模な側線が存在した。
sen.e: Adjacent to Yamazaki Station is a Suntory's distillery and once there existed larger scale side tracks.
sen.cmt: 「サントリーの工場」は「サントリーの蒸留所」としました（下記に「サントリー山崎蒸留所」との記載あり）。
sen.e: Adjacent to Yamazaki Station is a Suntory distillery, and once there existed side tracks of a larger scale.
Adjacent to Yamazaki Station is a Suntory distillery, and once there existed side tracks of a larger scale.

sen.j: 阪急電鉄大山崎駅とは、180m程（徒歩4分）の距離であり、京都・大阪間ではいちばん近接しているといってよい。
sen.e: Oyamazaki Station of the Hankyu Railway is located about 180 meters from Yamazaki Station (a 4-minute walk), which is the smallest distance between the stations in the section between Kyoto and Osaka.

Oyamazaki Station, of the Hankyu Railway, is located about 180 meters from Yamazaki Station (a four-minute walk), which is the shortest distance between any two consecutive stations in the section between Kyoto and Osaka.

Oyamazaki Station, of the Hankyu Railway, is located about 180 meters from Yamazaki Station (a four-minute walk), which is the shortest distance between any two consecutive stations in the section between Kyoto and Osaka.

sen.j: それぞれ優等列車は停車しない駅であるが、乗り換えの利用はけっこうある。
sen.e: Superior trains do not stop at these stations, but passengers use the stations for transfer.
Superior trains do not stop at these stations, but passengers use the stations for transfer.
Superior trains do not stop at these stations, but passengers use the stations for transfer.

sen.j: 京阪バスバス停（中央競馬開催日に京都競馬場への臨時バスが運行。）
sen.e: Bus stop operated by the Keihan Bus Co.,Ltd. (Special buses bound for Kyoto Race Course run on the days of horse-racing operated by the Japan Racing Association.)
A bus stop is operated by the Keihan Bus Co., Ltd. (with special buses bound for Kyoto Race Course running on the days of horse racing operated by the Japan Racing Association)
A bus stop of Keihan Bus Co., Ltd. (with special buses bound for Kyoto Race Course running on the days of horse racing operated by the Japan Racing Association)

sen.j: 京阪シティバスバス停（淀駅まで運行。）
sen.e: Keihan City Bus, bus stop (Buses run to (Keihan) Yodo Station.)
Keihan City Bus, bus stop (buses running to (Keihan) Yodo Station)
A bus stop of Keihan City Bus (buses running to (Keihan) Yodo Station)
A bus stop of Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd.
A bus stop of Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd.
Yamazaki-no-tatakai-ato (remains of the Battle of Yamazaki))

sen.cmt: 英語の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 大山崎瓦窯跡 （国指定史跡）
sen.e: Remains of the Oyamazaki tile kiln (a national historic site)
sen.cmt: 英語の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: サントリー山崎蒸溜所
2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約6,929人である。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 6,929 in 2006.
The number of passengers per day was about 6,929 in 2006.
The number of passengers per day was about 6,929 in fiscal year 2006.
(Adapted from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book)
(according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）8月9日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: Yamazaki Station was opened by the Japan National Railways (JNR) on August 9, 1876.
Yamazaki Station was opened by Japan National Railways (JNR) on August 9, 1876.
August 9, 1876: Yamazaki Station was opened by Japan National Railways (JNR).
The passenger and freight services began.
Passenger and freight services were offered.
Passenger and freight services were offered.

sen.j: 1971年（昭和46年）10月1日 - 貨物取扱が廃止。
sen.e: The freight service was discontinued on October 1, 1971.
The freight service was discontinued on October 1, 1971.
October 1, 1971: The freight service was discontinued.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1987 the station came to be operated by the JR West as a result of division and privatization of JNR.
On April 1, 1987, the station came to be operated by JR West as a result of the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: The station came to be operated by JR West as a result of the division and privatization of JNR.

sen.cmt: Rapid としました。・を/に変更しました。■を削除しました。

sen.e: Special Rapid and Rapid trains do not stop at Yamazaki Station.
Special rapid and rapid trains don't stop at Yamazaki Station.
Special rapid and rapid trains don't stop at Yamazaki Station.

sen.j: ■普通（高槻駅以西で快速となる列車含む）
sen.e: ■Local (including Local trains that run as Rapid trains at Takatsuki Station and stations to the west of Takatsuki Station)
■Local (including local ones that run as rapid trains at Takatsuki Station and stations to the west)
Local (including local ones that run as rapid trains at Takatsuki Station and stations to the west)

sen.j: 長岡京駅 - 山崎駅 - 島本駅
sen.e: Nagaokakyo Station - Yamazaki Station - Shimamoto Station
Nagaokakyo Station - Yamazaki Station - Shimamoto Station
